khīragāma： khīragāma（pu）

[khīra+gāma]
[ခီရ+ဂါမ]

Khīragāma：1．Khīragāma．-A village in Rohana，where the forces of Parakkamabāhu I fought a battle against the rebels （Cv．lxxiv．162f）．In Khīragāma Queen Ratnāvalī was cremated，and on the spot a cetiya was erected．Cv．lxxix．71； see also Cv．Trs．ii．36，n．2．



2．Khīragāma．-See Mahākhīragāma．
